intro: Capnites crenulatus, commonly known as the wavy-leaved capnites, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, wavy-edged leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Capnites crenulatus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it should be handled with care as it contains toxic compounds.
